channel.title: @ Colors?
channel.description:
so i got a new client for my server (stabbingscape v3) and in my old client when i typed @red@,@cya@,@mag@,@blu@,@yel@,@lre@, ETC... i would get colors with my yell... now it just shows @cya@ in the dialogue box... heres a picture : [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Ui2dGfU.png[/img]
when i type in the source, like on the quest tab, the colors work its just in the dialogue box. (any @color@ in the dialogue box doesnt work, no matter what). please reply with a solution for my problem...

item.title: @ Colors?
item.dc:creator: @OGolemX OGolemX
item.description:
@OGolemX wrote:

Oh, but my new client handles models better, the models in this one are more clear, and in the other one they were not the same.
I have a sword thats perfect in the new client and i went on the old client and it showed as a hay stack.
If you can jar my client please help me from teamviewer because after i jar it myself it wont open idk why, but i still need to fix colors before i .jar it, or i atleast need to know how to type my colors in my client because i found nothing, if any help from teamviewer or skype is possible it would be great,
Skype nAme : Keithewewew35

Read full topic

item.title: @ Colors?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

OGolemX:

I switched because the other one couldnt be jarred, and this one makes the models look better, and theres a bar at the top where you can go to the server website, unlike the old one

If you were jarring the client, that bar wouldn’t matter considering it’d be lost as is.
Oh, and they all can be jarred, it just takes a minute to prepare it.

Read full topic

edit: DIDNT WORK :([/quote]

Cause that seems to be the root of the problem.

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“OGolemX, post:14, topic:480305”]Errm, i tried decimal and hexidecimal codes (or whatever they are called) but both didnt work, it just types the “color code” in the dialogue box. Please just help me find out how to make the @cya@, etc work because all my sendMessages are already using those color codes.
Btw if you wonder why, its because i changed to a better client. Stabbingscape v4.1[/quote]
It’s handled client sided as is, so best you look there…

Btw if you wonder why, its because i changed to a better client. Stabbingscape v4.1

item.title: @ Colors?
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

HTML color codes are just hexidecimal codes. Decimal codes looks like this: 12595455 and hexidecimal look like this: C030FF

Read full topic

item.title: @ Colors?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“goudont, post:9, topic:480305”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=598540.msg4209676#msg4209676 date=1359357272]
DECIMAL color codes.
Get it right.
[/quote]

…
it’s the same thing…[/quote]
Er… Usually people would use the Hex codes, rgb. Most use rgba now… Not decimal. I’ve never seen a site run on decimal… Lol

Read full topic

try using <col=DecimalColorNumberhere> Text
They might of added a different color system in.
[/quote]

That’s what I said, golem. You may have to use html colour codes if your regular colors don’t work.[/quote]
